segment.source: MD Conversion - Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune

segment.source: can help you to secure your managed computers in a number of ways, including Endpoint Protection which provides real-time protection against malware threats, keeps malware definitions up-to date, and automatically scans computers.
segment.target: can help you to secure your managed computers in a number of ways, including Endpoint Protection which provides real-time protection against malware threats, keeps malware definitions up-to date, and automatically scans computers.

segment.source: also provides tools that help you to manage and monitor malware attacks
segment.target: also provides tools that help you to manage and monitor malware attacks

segment.source: If you have not yet installed the client on your computers, see Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: If you have not yet installed the client on your computers, see Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Use the information in the following sections to help you configure, deploy and monitor .
segment.target: Use the information in the following sections to help you configure, deploy and monitor .

segment.source: Using Endpoint Protection in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Using Endpoint Protection in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Before you start
segment.target: Before you start

segment.source: As an IT admin, one of your top priorities is to keep the computers that you manage free of malware and viruses.
segment.target: As an IT admin, one of your top priorities is to keep the computers that you manage free of malware and viruses.

segment.source: Before you deploy to client computers in your organization, you should decide how to protect your computers by selecting one of the following options and configuring its associated policy settings:
segment.target: Before you deploy to client computers in your organization, you should decide how to protect your computers by selecting one of the following options and configuring its associated policy settings:

segment.source: I want to:
segment.target: I want to:

segment.source: Endpoint Protection policy settings
segment.target: Endpoint Protection policy settings

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Use only if no third-party endpoint protection application is installed
segment.target: Use only if no third-party endpoint protection application is installed

segment.source: You can use on all computers where a third-party endpoint protection application is not installed.
segment.target: You can use on all computers where a third-party endpoint protection application is not installed.

segment.source: Install Endpoint Protection = Yes
segment.target: Install Endpoint Protection = Yes

segment.source: Enable Endpoint Protection = Yes
segment.target: Enable Endpoint Protection = Yes

segment.source: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed = No
segment.target: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed = No

segment.source: If a third-party endpoint protection application is detected, will not be installed, or will be uninstalled if it has already been installed.
segment.target: If a third-party endpoint protection application is detected, will not be installed, or will be uninstalled if it has already been installed.

segment.source: Use , even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed
segment.target: Use , even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed

segment.source: With this approach, you will be running and the third party endpoint protection application (if it is installed) simultaneously.
segment.target: With this approach, you will be running and the third party endpoint protection application (if it is installed) simultaneously.

segment.source: This is not a recommended configuration because of potential performance issues.
segment.target: This is not a recommended configuration because of potential performance issues.

segment.source: Install Endpoint Protection = Yes
segment.target: Install Endpoint Protection = Yes

segment.source: Enable Endpoint Protection = Yes
segment.target: Enable Endpoint Protection = Yes

segment.source: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed = Yes
segment.target: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third-party endpoint protection application is installed = Yes

segment.source: Use when:
segment.target: Use when:

segment.source: You want to switch to using .
segment.target: You want to switch to using .

segment.source: You deploy a new client that will use
segment.target: You deploy a new client that will use

segment.source: You upgrade any client that will use .
segment.target: You upgrade any client that will use .

segment.source: Use without
segment.target: Use without

segment.source: In this case, you won’t be using to protect your computers from malware and viruses.
segment.target: In this case, you won’t be using to protect your computers from malware and viruses.

segment.source: Instead, you will rely on a third-party endpoint protection application.
segment.target: Instead, you will rely on a third-party endpoint protection application.

segment.source: Install Endpoint Protection = No
segment.target: Install Endpoint Protection = No

segment.source: If you are not using a third-party endpoint protection application, this configuration is not recommended, as it could expose your organization’s computers to malware or other attacks.
segment.target: If you are not using a third-party endpoint protection application, this configuration is not recommended, as it could expose your organization’s computers to malware or other attacks.

segment.source: is not installed, and it is uninstalled if it was installed previously.
segment.target: is not installed, and it is uninstalled if it was installed previously.

segment.source: If you want to switch from your current endpoint protection application to , use the following steps which are explained in more detail later in this topic:
segment.target: If you want to switch from your current endpoint protection application to , use the following steps which are explained in more detail later in this topic:

segment.source: Leave your current endpoint protection application running while you deploy the client software to those computers.
segment.target: Leave your current endpoint protection application running while you deploy the client software to those computers.

segment.source: Confirm that is installed and is helping to secure client computers.
segment.target: Confirm that is installed and is helping to secure client computers.

segment.source: Remove the third-party endpoint protection software by:
segment.target: Remove the third-party endpoint protection software by:

segment.source: Using software distribution to deploy a software removal tool that is provided by the manufacturer of the third-party endpoint protection application.
segment.target: Using software distribution to deploy a software removal tool that is provided by the manufacturer of the third-party endpoint protection application.

segment.source: For more information, see Deploy and configure apps with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Deploy and configure apps with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Removing the third-party endpoint protection application manually.
segment.target: Removing the third-party endpoint protection application manually.

segment.source: will not uninstall third-party endpoint protection applications.
segment.target: will not uninstall third-party endpoint protection applications.

segment.source: How to configure Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection
segment.target: How to configure Microsoft Intune Endpoint Protection

segment.source: Use the following procedure to help you configure for .
segment.target: Use the following procedure to help you configure for .

segment.source: can manage for Windows 10 Technical Preview.
segment.target: can manage for Windows 10 Technical Preview.

segment.source: Certain policy settings are only available for Windows 10.
segment.target: Certain policy settings are only available for Windows 10.

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Configure and deploy a Microsoft Intune Agent Settings policy for the settings.
segment.target: Configure and deploy a Microsoft Intune Agent Settings policy for the settings.

segment.source: You can use recommended settings or customize the settings.
segment.target: You can use recommended settings or customize the settings.

segment.source: If you need more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client topic.
segment.target: If you need more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client topic.

segment.source: The tables after this procedure show the values you can configure in the policy and also the recommended values that will be used if you don’t customize the policy.
segment.target: The tables after this procedure show the values you can configure in the policy and also the recommended values that will be used if you don’t customize the policy.

segment.source: You can find these settings in the Endpoint Protection section.
segment.target: You can find these settings in the Endpoint Protection section.

segment.source: You can view the deployed policy on the All Policies page of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: You can view the deployed policy on the All Policies page of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Endpoint Protection service settings
segment.target: Endpoint Protection service settings

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Install Endpoint Protection
segment.target: Install Endpoint Protection

segment.source: Set to Yes to install on managed computers.
segment.target: Set to Yes to install on managed computers.

segment.source: If a third-party endpoint protection application is detected during installation, will not be installed unless Install Endpoint Protection even if a third party endpoint protection application is installed is set to Yes.
segment.target: If a third-party endpoint protection application is detected during installation, will not be installed unless Install Endpoint Protection even if a third party endpoint protection application is installed is set to Yes.

segment.source: Intune is installed on managed computers by default.
segment.target: Intune is installed on managed computers by default.

segment.source: If you don’t want installed on your managed computers, you must explicitly set this policy to No.
segment.target: If you don’t want installed on your managed computers, you must explicitly set this policy to No.

segment.source: If was previously installed and the policy is updated to No, then the client will be uninstalled.
segment.target: If was previously installed and the policy is updated to No, then the client will be uninstalled.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third party endpoint protection application is installed
segment.target: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third party endpoint protection application is installed

segment.source: Set to Yes to install even if a third-party endpoint protection application is detected.
segment.target: Set to Yes to install even if a third-party endpoint protection application is detected.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Enable Endpoint Protection
segment.target: Enable Endpoint Protection

segment.source: Set to Yes to enable on computers which have the client.
segment.target: Set to Yes to enable on computers which have the client.

segment.source: If set to No, and is installed, the client user interface is not displayed to users and all protection features are inactive.
segment.target: If set to No, and is installed, the client user interface is not displayed to users and all protection features are inactive.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Disable Client UI
segment.target: Disable Client UI

segment.source: Set to Yes to hide the client user interface from users (requires a client computer restart to take effect).
segment.target: Set to Yes to hide the client user interface from users (requires a client computer restart to take effect).

segment.source: Recommended value: No
segment.target: Recommended value: No

segment.source: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third party endpoint protection application is installed
segment.target: Install Endpoint Protection even if a third party endpoint protection application is installed

segment.source: Set to Yes to force the installation of , even if a third-party endpoint protection application is detected.
segment.target: Set to Yes to force the installation of , even if a third-party endpoint protection application is detected.

segment.source: Recommended value: No
segment.target: Recommended value: No

segment.source: Create a system restore point before malware remediation
segment.target: Create a system restore point before malware remediation

segment.source: Set to Yes to create a Windows System Restore Point before any malware remediation begins.
segment.target: Set to Yes to create a Windows System Restore Point before any malware remediation begins.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Track resolved malware (days)
segment.target: Track resolved malware (days)

segment.source: Lets track resolved malware for a specified time so that you can manually check previously infected computers.
segment.target: Lets track resolved malware for a specified time so that you can manually check previously infected computers.

segment.source: You can specify a value from 0 to 30 days.
segment.target: You can specify a value from 0 to 30 days.

segment.source: Recommended value: 7 days
segment.target: Recommended value: 7 days

segment.source: If you have set the policy values for Install Endpoint Protection and Enable Endpoint Protection to Yes, and the policy value for Install Endpoint Protection even if a third party endpoint protection application is installed to No, will detect that another endpoint protection application is installed and will be not be installed, or uninstalled if it is already present (however, does report about the health of the other endpoint protection application in the ).
segment.target: If you have set the policy values for Install Endpoint Protection and Enable Endpoint Protection to Yes, and the policy value for Install Endpoint Protection even if a third party endpoint protection application is installed to No, will detect that another endpoint protection application is installed and will be not be installed, or uninstalled if it is already present (however, does report about the health of the other endpoint protection application in the ).

segment.source: Real-time protection settings
segment.target: Real-time protection settings

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Enable real-time protection
segment.target: Enable real-time protection

segment.source: Enables monitoring and scanning of all files and applications that are accessed.
segment.target: Enables monitoring and scanning of all files and applications that are accessed.

segment.source: It also blocks any malicious files and applications before they can run on computers.
segment.target: It also blocks any malicious files and applications before they can run on computers.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Scan all downloads
segment.target: Scan all downloads

segment.source: Enables the scanning of all files and attachments that are downloaded from the Internet to computers.
segment.target: Enables the scanning of all files and attachments that are downloaded from the Internet to computers.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Monitor file and program activity on computers
segment.target: Monitor file and program activity on computers

segment.source: Enables the monitoring of incoming files and outgoing files, and program activity on computers.
segment.target: Enables the monitoring of incoming files and outgoing files, and program activity on computers.

segment.source: With this setting, can monitor when files and programs start to run and alert you about any actions they perform or actions that are taken on them.
segment.target: With this setting, can monitor when files and programs start to run and alert you about any actions they perform or actions that are taken on them.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Files monitored
segment.target: Files monitored

segment.source: If Monitor file and program activity on computers is enabled, this setting allows you to choose if only incoming, only outgoing, or all files are monitored.
segment.target: If Monitor file and program activity on computers is enabled, this setting allows you to choose if only incoming, only outgoing, or all files are monitored.

segment.source: Recommended value: Monitor all files
segment.target: Recommended value: Monitor all files

segment.source: Enable behavior monitoring
segment.target: Enable behavior monitoring

segment.source: Allows to check for certain patterns of suspicious activity on client computers.
segment.target: Allows to check for certain patterns of suspicious activity on client computers.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Enable Network Inspection System
segment.target: Enable Network Inspection System

segment.source: Enables Network Inspection System (NIS) on client computers.
segment.target: Enables Network Inspection System (NIS) on client computers.

segment.source: NIS uses signatures of known vulnerabilities from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center to help detect and block malicious network traffic.
segment.target: NIS uses signatures of known vulnerabilities from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center to help detect and block malicious network traffic.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Scan schedule settings
segment.target: Scan schedule settings

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Schedule a daily quick scan
segment.target: Schedule a daily quick scan

segment.source: Schedules a daily quick scan of both frequently used files and important system files on computers.
segment.target: Schedules a daily quick scan of both frequently used files and important system files on computers.

segment.source: This quick scan has a minimal effect on performance.
segment.target: This quick scan has a minimal effect on performance.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Run a quick scan if you have missed two consecutive scans
segment.target: Run a quick scan if you have missed two consecutive scans

segment.source: Configures to automatically run a quick scan on computers if they miss two consecutive, scheduled quick scans.
segment.target: Configures to automatically run a quick scan on computers if they miss two consecutive, scheduled quick scans.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Schedule a full scan
segment.target: Schedule a full scan

segment.source: Configures a full scan of all files and resources on the local hard disks of computers.
segment.target: Configures a full scan of all files and resources on the local hard disks of computers.

segment.source: This scan can take some time and can affect computer performance (depending on the number of files and resources scanned).
segment.target: This scan can take some time and can affect computer performance (depending on the number of files and resources scanned).

segment.source: Recommended value: No
segment.target: Recommended value: No

segment.source: Run a full scan if you have missed two consecutive full scans
segment.target: Run a full scan if you have missed two consecutive full scans

segment.source: Configures to automatically run a full scan on computers if they miss two consecutive, scheduled full scans.
segment.target: Configures to automatically run a full scan on computers if they miss two consecutive, scheduled full scans.

segment.source: Recommend value: Not configured
segment.target: Recommend value: Not configured

segment.source: Scan options settings
segment.target: Scan options settings

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Run a full scan after installation of Endpoint Protection
segment.target: Run a full scan after installation of Endpoint Protection

segment.source: Configures to automatically run a full system scan after it is installed on computers.
segment.target: Configures to automatically run a full system scan after it is installed on computers.

segment.source: This scan runs only when computers are idle to minimize the effect on user productivity.
segment.target: This scan runs only when computers are idle to minimize the effect on user productivity.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Automatically run a full scan when needed to follow up malware removal
segment.target: Automatically run a full scan when needed to follow up malware removal

segment.source: Set to Yes to let automatically run a full system scan on computers after the removal of malware to help confirm that other files were not affected.
segment.target: Set to Yes to let automatically run a full system scan on computers after the removal of malware to help confirm that other files were not affected.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Start a scheduled scan only when the computer is idle
segment.target: Start a scheduled scan only when the computer is idle

segment.source: Set to Yes to prevent scheduled scans from starting when computers are in use to prevent any loss of user productivity.
segment.target: Set to Yes to prevent scheduled scans from starting when computers are in use to prevent any loss of user productivity.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Check for the latest malware definitions before starting a scan
segment.target: Check for the latest malware definitions before starting a scan

segment.source: Set to Yes to let automatically check for the latest malware definitions before it starts a scan on computers.
segment.target: Set to Yes to let automatically check for the latest malware definitions before it starts a scan on computers.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Scan archive files
segment.target: Scan archive files

segment.source: Set to Yes to configure to scan for malware in archive files (like .zip or .cab files) on computers.
segment.target: Set to Yes to configure to scan for malware in archive files (like .zip or .cab files) on computers.

segment.source: Recommended value: No
segment.target: Recommended value: No

segment.source: Scan email messages
segment.target: Scan email messages

segment.source: Set to Yes to configure to scan incoming email messages when they arrive on computers.
segment.target: Set to Yes to configure to scan incoming email messages when they arrive on computers.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Scan files opened from network shared folders
segment.target: Scan files opened from network shared folders

segment.source: Set to Yes to configure to scan files that are opened from shared folders on the network.
segment.target: Set to Yes to configure to scan files that are opened from shared folders on the network.

segment.source: These are typically files that are accessed by using a UNC path.
segment.target: These are typically files that are accessed by using a UNC path.

segment.source: Enabling this feature can cause problems for users who have read-only access because they cannot remove malware.
segment.target: Enabling this feature can cause problems for users who have read-only access because they cannot remove malware.

segment.source: Recommended value: No
segment.target: Recommended value: No

segment.source: Scan mapped network drives
segment.target: Scan mapped network drives

segment.source: Set to Yes to configure to scan files on mapped network drives.
segment.target: Set to Yes to configure to scan files on mapped network drives.

segment.source: Enabling this feature can cause problems for users who have read-only access because they cannot remove malware.
segment.target: Enabling this feature can cause problems for users who have read-only access because they cannot remove malware.

segment.source: Recommended value: No
segment.target: Recommended value: No

segment.source: Scan removable drives
segment.target: Scan removable drives

segment.source: Set to Yes to configure to scan for malware and unwanted software in the contents of removable drives, like USB flash drives, when you run a full scan on computers.
segment.target: Set to Yes to configure to scan for malware and unwanted software in the contents of removable drives, like USB flash drives, when you run a full scan on computers.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Limit CPU usage during a scan
segment.target: Limit CPU usage during a scan

segment.source: Configures the maximum percentage of CPU usage that can be used during scheduled scans on computers.
segment.target: Configures the maximum percentage of CPU usage that can be used during scheduled scans on computers.

segment.source: You can set this value from 1 to 100 percent.
segment.target: You can set this value from 1 to 100 percent.

segment.source: Recommended value: 50%
segment.target: Recommended value: 50%

segment.source: Default actions settings
segment.target: Default actions settings

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Choose how Endpoint Protection acts on malware of the following alert levels
segment.target: Choose how Endpoint Protection acts on malware of the following alert levels

segment.source: Specifies the default action that takes when malware of various alert levels is detected.
segment.target: Specifies the default action that takes when malware of various alert levels is detected.

segment.source: For each alert level, you can remove the malware, quarantine it, or take Microsoft’s recommended action.
segment.target: For each alert level, you can remove the malware, quarantine it, or take Microsoft’s recommended action.

segment.source: Recommended value: Recommended action
segment.target: Recommended value: Recommended action

segment.source: Excluded files and folders settings
segment.target: Excluded files and folders settings

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Files and folders to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection
segment.target: Files and folders to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection

segment.source: Excludes specific files or folders when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.
segment.target: Excludes specific files or folders when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.

segment.source: Excluded processes settings
segment.target: Excluded processes settings

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Processes to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection
segment.target: Processes to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection

segment.source: Lets you exclude specific processes when a scan is run or from real-time protection.
segment.target: Lets you exclude specific processes when a scan is run or from real-time protection.

segment.source: You can exclude only files with the following extensions: .exe, .com or .scr.
segment.target: You can exclude only files with the following extensions: .exe, .com or .scr.

segment.source: Excluded file types settings
segment.target: Excluded file types settings

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: File extensions to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection
segment.target: File extensions to exclude when running a scan or using real-time protection

segment.source: Lets you exclude specific file name extensions when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.
segment.target: Lets you exclude specific file name extensions when a scan is run or when real-time protection is used on computers.

segment.source: Microsoft Active Protection Service Settings
segment.target: Microsoft Active Protection Service Settings

segment.source: Microsoft Active Protection Service is an online community that helps you decide how to respond to potential threats.
segment.target: Microsoft Active Protection Service is an online community that helps you decide how to respond to potential threats.

segment.source: The community also helps stop the spread of new malware infections.
segment.target: The community also helps stop the spread of new malware infections.

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Join Microsoft Active Protection Service
segment.target: Join Microsoft Active Protection Service

segment.source: Yes automatically sends information about detected malware to the Microsoft Active Protection Service.
segment.target: Yes automatically sends information about detected malware to the Microsoft Active Protection Service.

segment.source: Microsoft does not use any information collected to identify you or to contact you.
segment.target: Microsoft does not use any information collected to identify you or to contact you.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Membership level
segment.target: Membership level

segment.source: If you selected to join the Microsoft Active Protection Service, this setting lets you choose from one of the following membership levels:
segment.target: If you selected to join the Microsoft Active Protection Service, this setting lets you choose from one of the following membership levels:

segment.source: Basic - Sends basic information to Microsoft about detected malware.
segment.target: Basic - Sends basic information to Microsoft about detected malware.

segment.source: This includes where the software came from, the actions that you apply or that applies automatically, and whether the actions were successful.
segment.target: This includes where the software came from, the actions that you apply or that applies automatically, and whether the actions were successful.

segment.source: Advanced - Sends more information to Microsoft about malware, spyware, and potentially unwanted software.
segment.target: Advanced - Sends more information to Microsoft about malware, spyware, and potentially unwanted software.

segment.source: This includes the location of the software, file names, how the software operates, and how it has affected your computer.
segment.target: This includes the location of the software, file names, how the software operates, and how it has affected your computer.

segment.source: Recommended value: Advanced
segment.target: Recommended value: Advanced

segment.source: Receive dynamic definitions based on Microsoft Active Protection Service reports
segment.target: Receive dynamic definitions based on Microsoft Active Protection Service reports

segment.source: Yes lets computers receive dynamic malware definitions based on information that sends to the Microsoft Active Protection Service (if you have joined it) about detected malware.
segment.target: Yes lets computers receive dynamic malware definitions based on information that sends to the Microsoft Active Protection Service (if you have joined it) about detected malware.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Management tasks for Endpoint Protection
segment.target: Management tasks for Endpoint Protection

segment.source: The following tasks help you to carry out various management tasks on managed computers that run .
segment.target: The following tasks help you to carry out various management tasks on managed computers that run .

segment.source: I want to
segment.target: I want to

segment.source: From the console
segment.target: From the console

segment.source: From the managed computer
segment.target: From the managed computer

segment.source: Update malware definitions
segment.target: Update malware definitions

segment.source: From the Groups workspace, select the computers you want to update.
segment.target: From the Groups workspace, select the computers you want to update.

segment.source: Click Remote Tasks > Update Malware Definitions.
segment.target: Click Remote Tasks > Update Malware Definitions.

segment.source: Start the client software from the Windows notification area.
segment.target: Start the client software from the Windows notification area.

segment.source: Click the Update tab, and then click Update.
segment.target: Click the Update tab, and then click Update.

segment.source: Run a malware scan
segment.target: Run a malware scan

segment.source: From the Groups workspace, select the computers you want to scan.
segment.target: From the Groups workspace, select the computers you want to scan.

segment.source: Click Run a Full Malware Scan or Run a Quick Malware Scan.
segment.target: Click Run a Full Malware Scan or Run a Quick Malware Scan.

segment.source: Start the client software from the Windows notification area.
segment.target: Start the client software from the Windows notification area.

segment.source: Select Quick, Full, or Custom, and then click Scan now.
segment.target: Select Quick, Full, or Custom, and then click Scan now.

segment.source: You can view the status of a remote task by clicking the Remote Tasks link in the bottom right corner of the .
segment.target: You can view the status of a remote task by clicking the Remote Tasks link in the bottom right corner of the .

segment.source: The Remote Task Status dialog box lists current remote tasks, task status, device name, any reported errors, and provides a link to troubleshooting information, if appropriate.
segment.target: The Remote Task Status dialog box lists current remote tasks, task status, device name, any reported errors, and provides a link to troubleshooting information, if appropriate.

segment.source: How to monitor Endpoint Protection
segment.target: How to monitor Endpoint Protection

segment.source: You monitor the status of malware on your computers by using the Protection workspace of the Microsoft Intune administration console.
segment.target: You monitor the status of malware on your computers by using the Protection workspace of the Microsoft Intune administration console.

segment.source: This workspace contains two pages:
segment.target: This workspace contains two pages:

segment.source: Page name
segment.target: Page name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Endpoint Protection Overview
segment.target: Endpoint Protection Overview

segment.source: Displays important issues as links that you can click for more information.
segment.target: Displays important issues as links that you can click for more information.

segment.source: Issues that might be displayed include:
segment.target: Issues that might be displayed include:

segment.source: Malware instances that need follow-up – Click the link to see a list of malware issues including the follow up action that needs to be taken to resolve the issue.
segment.target: Malware instances that need follow-up – Click the link to see a list of malware issues including the follow up action that needs to be taken to resolve the issue.

segment.source: You can further drill into this list to see which computers are affected.
segment.target: You can further drill into this list to see which computers are affected.

segment.source: Computers with malware that need follow-up – Click the link to see all computers with unresolved malware issues including the follow up action that needs to be taken to resolve the issue.
segment.target: Computers with malware that need follow-up – Click the link to see all computers with unresolved malware issues including the follow up action that needs to be taken to resolve the issue.

segment.source: Devices that are not protected – Click the link to see computers that are not protected by any endpoint protection software, either because no software is installed, or because there is an error.
segment.target: Devices that are not protected – Click the link to see computers that are not protected by any endpoint protection software, either because no software is installed, or because there is an error.

segment.source: Select a computer to view more details.
segment.target: Select a computer to view more details.

segment.source: Devices with another endpoint protection application running – Click the link to see computers that are running a third-party endpoint protection application.
segment.target: Devices with another endpoint protection application running – Click the link to see computers that are running a third-party endpoint protection application.

segment.source: All Malware
segment.target: All Malware

segment.source: Displays a list of all active malware found on your computers.
segment.target: Displays a list of all active malware found on your computers.

segment.source: You can drill into this list to see all computers that are affected by a particular piece of malware, or you can select one of the following tasks:
segment.target: You can drill into this list to see all computers that are affected by a particular piece of malware, or you can select one of the following tasks:

segment.source: View Properties – Opens a page with more information about the selected malware.
segment.target: View Properties – Opens a page with more information about the selected malware.

segment.source: Learn About This Malware – Opens a topic from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center with more information about the malware.
segment.target: Learn About This Malware – Opens a topic from the Microsoft Malware Protection Center with more information about the malware.

segment.source: The Protection workspace is not displayed in the administrator console until you have installed the client on, and are successfully managing at least one computer client.
segment.target: The Protection workspace is not displayed in the administrator console until you have installed the client on, and are successfully managing at least one computer client.

segment.source: How to view Recent Detection Paths for malware on computers
segment.target: How to view Recent Detection Paths for malware on computers

segment.source: Intune can display the paths of up to 10 most recently detected instances of malware on a device.
segment.target: Intune can display the paths of up to 10 most recently detected instances of malware on a device.

segment.source: The Recent Detection Path is disabled by default.
segment.target: The Recent Detection Path is disabled by default.

segment.source: To enable this view:
segment.target: To enable this view:

segment.source: How to enable Recent Detection Paths for malware
segment.target: How to enable Recent Detection Paths for malware

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Devices .
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console go Groups > All Devices .

segment.source: Malware.
segment.target: Malware.

segment.source: Right-click a column header.
segment.target: Right-click a column header.

segment.source: A list of available columns appears.
segment.target: A list of available columns appears.

segment.source: Mark the Recent Detection Paths checkbox in the list.
segment.target: Mark the Recent Detection Paths checkbox in the list.

segment.source: The Recent Detection Paths column appears and displays up to 10 most recent malware instances monitored on the device.
segment.target: The Recent Detection Paths column appears and displays up to 10 most recent malware instances monitored on the device.

segment.source: Need more help?
segment.target: Need more help?

segment.source: For further help and support, see Troubleshoot Endpoint Protection in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For further help and support, see Troubleshoot Endpoint Protection in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune
